page.title: 10Arts and Crafts - Hedging
page.content: Hedging is becoming rather rare with the development of modern hedge trimmers, but when a hedge has not been trimmed for some years it has to be "laid". This is done by cutting and thinning it down, choosing tall straight young hawthorn to lay sideways at an angle of 45 degrees. Each stem is chopped half through at the base so that it will bend, and when several are laid, stakes are inserted to secure them in place. The following years young shoots will appear growing upwards and eventually, these can by trimmed by machine.
